title: Mel Stride vows ‘no fear or favour’ at Treasury Committee
text:
Former Treasury minister Mel Stride has promised to act “without fear or favour” as chairman of the committee that scrutinises the department's policies after MPs warned he risks “marking his own homework”.

The Tory MP insisted he will behave independently when running the Treasury select committee, but declined to say if it will investigate a controversial tax on contractors that he helped to introduce.

Mr Stride said: “I want to reassure all MPs and members of the public that the Treasury Committee will hold the Government fully to account without fear or favour.

“The Committee has yet to meet formally since the election. When we do meet next week, I look forward to discussing the challenges...
description: Former Treasury minister Mel Stride has promised to act “without fear or favour” as chairman of the committee that scrutinises the department's policies after MPs warned he risks “marking his own homework”.
